page.syntax: Ending_Date as D = ADD_BUS_DAYS( Starting_Date as D, Add_Days as N [, Ignore_Holiday_Flag as C [, Holiday_Table as C ]] )

argument.name: Starting_Date
argument.description: The starting date to which you will add business days.

argument.name: Add_Days
argument.description: A positive or negative number ( not zero). The number of business days to add or subtract. The function does not count weekend days.

argument.name: Ignore_Holiday_Flag
argument.description: Optional. Default = "". If Ignore_Holiday_Flag is any non-null value, the function subtracts holidays from the number of non-weekend days.

argument.name: Holiday_Table
argument.description: Optional. Default = "a_holidays.dbf". If Ignore_Holiday_Flag is "yes", the function uses the list of holidays is supplied in Holiday_Table. If Holiday_Table is blank, then Alpha Five uses the "a_holidays.dbf" table which is contained in the Alpha Five program folder. The holidays in the "a_holidays.dbf" table are defined in the Settings dialog box, accessed with the View > Settings > System > Holidays command from the Alpha Five menus.

page.description: ADD_BUS_DAYS() returns an Ending_Date equal to Starting_Date plus Add_Days number of business days.

section.title: SQL 'Holidays' Table
section.description: Add_bus_days() can use a SQL table as the data source for the list of holiday dates. To specify a SQL table, the 'holidayTable' argument that is passed into the function is in the form of a JSON string with these properties:

case.description: connectionString - the connection string to the SQL database
table - the name of the table that contains the holiday dates. If this property is not specified a table called 'A5Holidays' is assumed.
column - the name of the column that contains the holiday dates. If this property is not specified, a column called 'Dates' is assumed.
filterColumn - (optional) the name of a column in the holiday table that you want to filter on
filterColumnType - (required if filterColumn is specified) - the data type of the filterColumn. Can be c,n,d,t,l.
filterValue - (required if filterColumn is specified) - the value to search for.

section.title: Example
section.example:
days = Bus_days_between( {12/1/2013},{12/31/2013},"yes","{connectionstring: 'myconnstring', table: 'holidays', column: 'dates'}")
days = Bus_days_between( {12/1/2013},{12/31/2013},"yes","{connectionstring: 'myconnstring', table: 'holidays', column: 'dates', filterColumn: 'country', filterColumnType: 'c', filterValue: 'USA'}")
